subject: Re: Testing Multithreaded Code
msgSnippet: Unit testing concurrent code is very hard. You can t rely on unit test to impose every concurrent errors. Here unit test only can offer some comfort .
messageBody:
Unit testing concurrent code is very hard. You can't rely on unit test
to impose every concurrent errors. Here unit test only can offer some
"comfort". However, you can read Brian Goetz's new book "Java
concurrency in practice" (Chapter 12 "Testing councurrent programs")
for more advices.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "lancezant" <lancezant@...> wrote:
>
> What's the recommended way to make sure a test fail/errors if a thread
> spawned in the code under test throws and exception? Perhaps
> something similar to the threadedTesting.jar, but more current? (That
> was posted in Nov 2001, and would need work to compile with a current
> jdk.)
>
> TIA,
> Lance
>
